title: Calories in Pancakes with Syrup
meta_description: Discover calories in pancakes with syrup for a standard serving of two, plus full nutrition breakdown, macros, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Two medium (4-inch) buttermilk pancakes topped with 2 tablespoons pure maple syrup; no butter, fruit, or other toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, size, syrup type, and preparation method. Check labels or recipes for exact values.

quick_answer.text: Two pancakes with 2 tbsp syrup provide ~290 kcal, primarily from carbohydrates.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one pancake with syrup?
faqs.a: About 145 kcal for one medium pancake with 1 tbsp maple syrup.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in pancakes with syrup?
faqs.a: Two pancakes with 2 tbsp syrup have ~56 g carbs, mostly from flour and syrup sugars.

faqs.q: Are pancakes with syrup high in sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, ~24 g sugars total from the syrup and batter; opt for low-sugar alternatives.

faqs.q: How does syrup affect calories in pancakes?
faqs.a: 2 tbsp maple syrup adds ~104 kcal; lighter pours reduce totals significantly.

faqs.q: Can I make lower-calorie pancakes with syrup?
